Every need you could possibly have is already anticipated — kitchen stocked with coffee, teas, and creamers; a welcome wine and snack basket; the washer complete with stain removers and sprays; bathrooms with extra toiletries; baby crib and accessories; and a large box of box of board games. The neighborhood is quaint and quiet and the backyard offers a great setup for evenings on the patio, should you visit in the summer. Phoebe was prompt to respond to every request and went above and beyond to make our stay absolutely wonderful. I could not recommend the Wetmore house more.

The cottage is clean and tidy. Everything we needed was available to us. We cooked/ate in most days, were easily able to do laundry as needed and were comfortable as a family of 5 at all times.
The location of the cottage is quiet and peaceful. The neighbors that were “home” while we visited were friendly and helpful. I felt comfortable allowing my kids (13, 11 and 8) to come and go as they pleased from the cottage down to the dock. They enjoyed swimming and floating at the dock, taking the kayaks around to explore and trying their hand at fishing for the first time.
Jamie and Akrum were on property the weekend we arrived and we’re so helpful in making coffee shop and restaurant recommendations, helped get us situated with the kayaks and gave us a thorough run down on the lake, how to get to Pike Lake, etc.

Jackie's place is beautiful and so much bigger than we expected! The beds are comfy, and it's so nice to have three separate bedrooms. The back bedroom is separated from the rest and feels especially private. It was also handy to have a powder room (toilet & sink) downstairs in addition to the full bathroom (shower, no tub) upstairs. There are many hooks for hanging things in the bedrooms and bathrooms plus full-rod closets in each bedroom. Towels are also plentiful. Everything was clean. And the apartment was quiet, in spite of being atop a business on a main street in the center of town. It's also just a few minutes' drive from the College and from the local chain grocery store (Kroger).
Some guests might like to know that the street parking, while close and convenient to the door, is all parallel, not angled head-in, but also that on the back (non-entrance) side of the building there is a big, well-lit parking lot with plenty of available spaces and it can be seen from the kitchen and back-bedroom windows. Others may appreciate a heads-up that the stairwell that goes to the third floor, where all of the bedrooms are, can be a little difficult to maneuver since the steps are of uneven depths. We managed fine; just had to remember to take them slow.
All in all, we were pleased with our stay at Jackie's and we will certainly consider coming again. Recommended!

review_text: The first thing I noticed upon opening the door to Mindi's place is that it still has that lovely smell of new wood. The house definitely is all new inside, very crisp and clean feeling, very modern. It is obvious that Mindi put much care into the design, layout, and furnishings during the remodel--terrific attention to detail. The mattresses are super comfy, the rooms are abundantly lit, the appliances are top-notch, and the kitchen is well equipped. Mindi's place also offers much privacy with frosted window panes in many key spots, a wooden panel fence on the only side that has a neighbor, and a secluded back yard. We enjoyed eating dinner outside on the patio and even saw deer come up from the creek at the back of the property. Pulling into or out of the driveway can be a little bit tricky, but it's not at all a busy street, and so many things in town (including the college campus) are delightfully walkable from this location anyway. It's situated right along railroad tracks, which we were concerned might pose a safety or noise issue, but by the end, we had to admit we were disappointed that not a single train went by during our 8-day stay. I highly recommend Mindi's place!

We've been talking about our wonderful stay at Emilie's place the entire drive home - and it's a long one!
We arrived very late but Emilie's directions were perfect and she had the light on for us. The apartment is so charming and she's maximized the space to provide everything you need. Due to the virus outbreak, she currently can't come up and cook breakfast but she left a full range of ingredients in the fridge for us, AND she hand-delivered a delicious breakfast quiche to us two different mornings!
We especially loved taking long walks on the property to see the ponds, observe the sheep and chickens, and just relax and spend time together. My wife had never been on a farm, so it was pretty special to show her a glimpse of how I grew up.
The highlight of the stay was walking out to the field with Emilie one evening to bring the sheep back to the yard. She answered our many questions and we loved playing with the dogs along the way and seeing them work on the return trip. The mornings were quite dewey, so if you'd rather go out with her then I'd recommend some rain boots. We actually bought some and didn't end up needing them so they're in the hall closet if you forget yours!
Emilie's description of the place is very accurate - WiFi is strong inside the apartment for everyday use, but we did have some problems with streaming. Not a problem for us - we opted instead to sit out on the deck and read. I would recommend bringing some bug spray with you though.
Overall this quiet retreat was exactly what we needed in the midst of this new crazy world. We will definitely be back - and will bring our fishing poles along next time! We highly recommend this place!
